findings.title: Vendor package importing from packages layer
findings.description: vendor/cms/components/body.tsx imports from packages/ui (2 imports). Vendor abstractions should be self-contained and not depend on shared packages.

findings.title: Packages importing from API layer (reverse dependency)
findings.description: 4 package files import from api layer: packages/console-trpc → api/console, packages/chat-trpc → api/chat, packages/chat-api-services → api/chat, packages/console-test-data → api/console. This creates reverse dependencies - packages should not depend on API implementations.

findings.title: Apps importing from DB layer directly (31 violations)
findings.description: apps/console and apps/chat import directly from db layer instead of going through API. Pattern affects apps/console/src/lib/v1/ (8 files), apps/console/src/lib/neural/ (14 files), apps/console/src/env.ts, apps/console/src/app routes (4 files), and apps/chat (2 files).

findings.title: Deep imports from vendor packages leaving boundaries
findings.description: turbo boundaries detected @vendor/cms deep imports (components/body, components/feed, env) being accessed from apps/www. These should be re-exported from the main @vendor/cms entry point.

findings.title: Type-only imports not declared as such
findings.description: core/ai-sdk imports from 'react' without type-only declaration. turbo boundaries detected 3 instances in use-chat.ts, use-delta-stream.ts, use-event-stream.ts.

findings.title: Undeclared dependencies
findings.description: turbo boundaries found missing dependencies: 'server-only' in vendor/clerk, '@eslint/eslintrc' in examples/nextjs-ai-chatbot.
